title: Pablo Picasso
content: At his baptism, Picasso was christened Pablo Diego José Francisco de Paula Juan Nepomuceno María de los Remedios Cipriano de la Santísima Trinidad Martyr Patricio Clito Ruíz y Picasso.

title: Caravaggio
content: In 1969, Caravaggio’s Nativity with St. Francis and Saint Lawrence was stolen from the Oratory of Saint Lawrence in Palermo.

title: Leonardo da Vinci
content: Though often referred to simply as “da Vinci,” the reality is that Leonardo did not have a last name. Da Vinci literally translates to “of Vinci,” which is his hometown.
